column6:
If it's not inconvenient to visit Kashikojima, we recommend The Hiramatsu Kashikojima or Basara House. Both have a pick-up service from Kashikojima Station and overlook Ago Bay, and there are few rooms so you can spend a quiet time.

The former is French for both evening and breakfast, and the service is good, so I think that the private open-air bath and meal guidance time are properly considered so as not to be in conflict with other guests.

The latter is Japanese for both evening and breakfast, and there are about 3 private open-air baths with different themes, and the lounge is spacious and comfortable. Since the site area is large, it may be difficult to move to the main building if you stay away. The service is homely and polite.

Both dishes are made with plenty of seafood and mountain food from the beautiful country, and it is difficult to add them.

I hope it will be a good holiday.

There are many shops aimed at tourists, and they all have good prices.
It's hard to get there by train, but if you go by car, go south on Route 136 from Mishima Taisha and go about 3-4 km, and you will find a restaurant called "Gotengawa" on your left in the direction of travel.
There are sashimi as well as eel. There is also a set of eel bowl and sashimi at the 2,000 yen level, and the menu is diverse.

A woman in her thirties. About 3 years ago, I traveled alone to Ogasawara (Hahajima / Chichijima). As you say, even one person can't float at all.

South Island (Dolphin & Sperm Whale) It was really good! I went on a tour called Papaya, but I heard that I'm not on a tour now.

For the land tour, I told them that I would like to go trekking for half a day with Papas, and asked the guide to take me to Asahiyama, Kasayama, and Akagashira Karasubat Sanctuary.

If you have time, it might be a good idea to go to Hahajima. It's a completely different atmosphere.

If you request a pamphlet from the Ogasawara Tourism Association, you will also receive information on guided tours, so I think it will not hurt to have it.

If you want to make a reservation online, we recommend the site called VELTRA. Word-of-mouth communication is described in the content, price, and required time, so it will be helpful when deciding.

I don't go on a night tour on Chichijima, but you can see mushrooms and bats that shine like Hahajima, look for turtles (Is it the release of turtles in October?), And observe the starry sky. Tabinchu-san looks good.

The Ogasawara Visitor Center, Ogasawara Fisheries Center, Ogasawara Marine Center, and Ogasawara World Heritage Center are all within walking distance from the port and you can enjoy getting to know Ogasawara for free, so it is recommended for a short time!

column6:
A middle-aged couple who will be sightseeing in Yakushima for 4 nights in late March.

I plan to divide Jomon cedar trekking and Shiratani Unsuikyo trekking into two days.

For Jomon cedar trekking, which takes more than 10 hours, I would like to walk with as little luggage as possible. Is there anything I need other than rainwear, beverages, groceries, portable toilets, paper, and regular medicine?
There is also an opinion that sneakers are easier to walk on the trolley road, but is it impossible to walk with sneakers for the entire process?

I would like to know about the points to note and clothes for this time of year.

Thank you.
column7: About equipment of Jomon cedar trekking and Shiratani Unsuikyo trekking

column6:
I went to Jomon cedar trekking (1st day) and Shiratani Unsuikyo trekking (2nd day) last year.
Since the time is different, I think that it may not be the case.

As for luggage, I didn't need a portable toilet and rainwear as a result.
Rainwear just happened to not rain on both days, so I think it is necessary as equipment.
There was no problem as long as the portable toilet was properly used in the middle of the toilet.

From my point of view, Jomon cedar is mostly flat roads, so it takes time and is not as tiring as you might think.
Shiratani Unsuikyo trekking was tired from the full-scale mountain road. (Maybe it's the second day) I

went with light climbing shoes (similar to sneakers).
If it's sunny, I think sneakers (for sports, not casual) are fine, but since you need to assume that you will get wet in the rain
, think about preventing rainwater from getting into your shoes, such as Gore-Tex or waterproof spray. I think it is necessary.

It's Jomon cedar, but I used to go back and forth by mountaineering bus or fixed-route bus without a guide.
On the way back, I arrived at the trailhead early and waited for more than an hour until the bus arrived.
There weren't many fixed-route buses after that, and there was a considerable loss of time, so in the case of buses, I think it would be better to think carefully about the timetable.
column7: About equipment of Jomon cedar trekking and Shiratani Unsuikyo trekking

column6:
Due to the relationship between the season (New Year) and physical strength, I do not go trekking in Jomon cedar
, but only in Unsuikyo, and I have only one day trekking experience.
Since I usually do light mountaineering , I thought I
would be "perfect" with climbing shoes and a leg cover for waterproofing, but I was scared
not in terms of "equipment" but in terms of "preparation".
I did.

In the evening, when I was about to go
down the mountain,
I slipped on the downhill wooden path (well-maintained, stepped) , landed next to my butt, and then
the cliff to the river. Stop lying face down toward. .. ..
I experienced a situation just before the slide. It wasn't

as
scary as "getting caught somewhere and just barely safe", but I had
to hit my hips, drag my legs down the mountain,
and search for compresses on Yakushima Island on New Year's Day. .. ..

Unsuikyo was a "mountain".
And "the danger awaits you when you go down the mountain."

Except for Sole, I still have a
lot of fun memories of the day in Unsuikyo , and I want to go there again, but
anyway, I

column7: About equipment of Jomon cedar trekking and Shiratani Unsuikyo trekking

column6:
Good evening.

Since there is mud on the way
, I think that waterproof trekking shoes such as Gore-Tex are good.

Do you usually exercise?

Jomon cedar trekking is probably tougher than you might imagine.

I ran at the gym twice a week, but when I arrived at Jomon Sugi, I was strained and had a
disastrous experience.
I think it will be useful in case of emergency if you bring a compress etc. just in case .

It is convenient to have hydration as well.

Also, in order to be fully enjoyed
, I think it is better to go to the easy Shiratani Unsuikyo (Moss Musu no Mori) first and then go trekking to Jomon cedar the next day.
column7: About equipment of Jomon cedar trekking and Shiratani Unsuikyo trekking

column6:
My name is 2013tomo.

We trekked Jomon cedar on Yakushima in late December 2015.

I don't know the weather in late March, but I
heard from the guide that it snowed a lot just before I went trekking .
The weather on Yakushima
is volatile, so I think it's safer to do the last survey and make appropriate preparations .

It depends on your physical strength and experience,
but I think that it is better to make the preparations as light as possible to prevent exhaustion of physical strength (especially in the latter half).
At the end, my knees were jerky and it was hard for me to walk.
(At that time, I was 65 years old and weighed 75 kg, and I was a little overweight.)
Also, there was a steep slope on the way, and I sometimes grabbed the vines and roots of the grass and climbed
, so I think it is better to bring work gloves to hurt your fingers.
I wore sturdy hiking shoes (
I think the product was "Kean").
Since Mt. Miyanoura was once a volcano, the tip of the rock (lava) is sharp and pointed,
so soft sneakers may hurt your feet.
However, elementary school students climbed on steep slopes with ordinary athletic shoes,
so it cannot be said unconditionally.
(Some foreigners climbed in sandals, but I think this is dangerous.)

Shiratani Unsuikyo
does not know much about trekking because we used taxi sightseeing .

Not only can you enjoy the beautiful nature on Yakushima, but you can also
meet the animals (deer and monkeys) that live in the nature, which made the
trekking very enjoyable .

The food at the guest house was also fresh and delicious.

For your reference, I have attached our Yakushima sightseeing blog.
"60th birthday couple world heritage Yakushima 5000 years Jomon cedar"
Tour the mossy forest of Princess Mononoke (2015/12 / 25 --2015 / 12/28)

Enjoy the nature of Yakushima.
column7: About equipment of Jomon cedar trekking and Shiratani Unsuikyo trekking

column6:
unako

I went to Yakushima last December and went trekking with a guided Jomon cedar and Shiratani Unsuikyo in two days. Will this trekking be guided? I don't think you'll get lost even if you don't have a guide, but considering the transportation to the trailhead, the pace distribution on the first course, and the explanation of the highlights, I think it's better to have a guide. To put it the other way around, I don't think it will be necessary after the second time.

Now, regarding equipment, we recommend that you bring stock in addition to what is already envisioned and what others have proposed. I was in my early 70s, and although I had no problem climbing, I was tired from going down and my legs became unstable, so I asked my guide to lend me some stock. Even on a steep slope, it became easier to go down while supporting it with both legs and stock.

I think Jomon cedar and Shiratani Unsuikyo will go for two days in a row, but on the second day, Shiratani Unsuikyo was a three-hour course to the shorter mossy forest. On the other hand, the young woman who was with me at Jomon Sugi applied for a 6-hour course to Taikoiwa in Shiratani Unsuikyo the next day. I think it depends on your physical strength and age, but considering the fatigue of Jomon cedar trekking, the shorter course was the correct answer. The next day's leg and body pain and fatigue were greater than I expected, and even the 3-hour course was quite difficult. At this time as well, the descent borrowed stock from the guide.

I rented mountain climbing shoes locally for both days, but I was able to walk comfortably with those shoes without any problems. The minecart road was not difficult to walk. With sneakers, the mountain trail seems uneasy. Especially when it rains, it will be muddy.

You may not be so worried because you are still young, but please be well prepared and have fun.

Kagawa Prefecture: eat around intently the noodles. Bone chicken is delicious. There must have been a place like Lake Uyuni in Mitoyo.

Ehime Prefecture: Imabari towels, Iwazumogana. Yakitori and Senzanki. Note that there are two types of snapper rice. The bridge that connects the Seto Inland Sea is spectacular. The storm of Hajikawa is nice in winter. Dogo Onsen will go! Sweets are Kiri no Mori Daifuku, tarts, etc ...

Kochi Prefecture: What should I look for in the subsidence bridge? There is also the Shimanto River. Hirome Market should go!
There is a Tosa diary for sweets, but I personally eat Hamako's legendary cream puffs. Also, nabeyaki ramen and nabeyaki pudding

Tokushima Prefecture: Oboke Koboke, etc. There is also a shrine near Tokushima station. Also, the Otsuka Museum of Art (the place where the red and white singer sang there). Tokushima ramen is good, but how about cherry blossoms and strawberries in different seasons?
column7: 5 days around Shikoku with a rental car

column6:
Depending on whether the departure point is Takamatsu or Honshu, the way of going around will be different and the conditions will change somewhat depending on the number of people in the group, so this is a rough advice without considering that area.

First of all, it is quite a long distance when it comes to going around Shikoku. However, it is recommended to drive on a tasteful general road rather than a highway. There are many narrow places on general roads, so driving should be done with frequent breaks and a schedule of lodging before dark, so you shouldn't be too greedy.

The advantage of traveling by car on a regular road is that you can stop at a roadside station in the countryside, which has a large selection of items. I also recommend it because the local supermarket is cheap and there are many items. On Sundays, the morning market in Kochi is a great open market.

I will omit the tourist spots because many people have already mentioned them, but Uwajima is a small city with a lot of taste. Both fruits and fish are cheap and abundant. Super Fuji, a local churn, also has a big store. Uwajima Castle is also a rare sea castle.

I hope it will be a fun trip.
